comments.commentBody: Honestly, this just sounds like a bunch of sore losers. There's no evidence of ANYTHING other than Trump's "associates" had contact with some Russians (a country where many of Trump associates are known to do business). So, what? They spoke to Russians. Why is the Obama administration gathering information on republican party members and/or associates to begin with?

Wow! 2409 Comments and growing! Well, after the Fall of Flynn, I was concerned that Trump had a fall guy and that would be that. There's never one cockroach. Sessions is bad to the bone, and no wonder he would be involved...I remember when President Obama said something on his last days in office, to the effect of 'I will be here for you...' He did something a true statesman does, he protected us. He took action so that these, yes, acts of treason, would not be destroyed. All in good time people. All in good time. Follow the bread crumbs...
Sessions. Would that be sessions, under oath??? He will deal in a heartbeat.  Uh-oh, Donald.

Thank God for the Obama Administration. They will be known as the whistle blowers who saved the day and our Republic once all this Intel comes to light. The counts of Impeachment will form a mountain of evidence against the most unqualified and corrupt odious creep ever to inhabit the Oval Office. The clock is already ticking for Trump and his White Supremacist Party. Anyone who continues to back Trump and the Republican Party truly now deserve the label deplorable. And that's being kind.

DD
Manhattan

"The details of the meetings were not clear, but the contact appeared to contradict testimony Mr. Sessions provided Congress during his confirmation hearing in January when he said he 'did not have communications with the Russians.'”

Why can't the NY Times even provide the smallest amount of context for that quote from Sessions?

Here's from a story about this from NBC news:

"Sessions was asked during his confirmation hearings by Sen. Al Franken what he would do if he learned that 'anyone affiliated with the Trump campaign communicated with the Russian government in the course of this campaign,' Sessions replied:

'I have been called a surrogate at a time or two in that campaign, and I did not have communications with the Russians, and I'm unable to comment on it.'"

How fair is the the Times' sinister depiction of Sessons' quote in the light of the ever so slightly expanded context?

How many times must the Times resort to stunts like this to make their partisan points?

All one-sided innuendo with no proof.   Yet when any anyone says that the left has hacked the elections, the first work out of a liberal's mouth is "there is no proof",  even though there is (e.g., 2008 Philadelphia and the Black Panthers, dead people voting, voting in more than one state, etc.).

This article edits the questions that were asked to create a desired narrative. 

The question Franken posed to Sessions was, was there a continuing exchange of information between the campaign and the Russian government about the election. 

It was not, did Sessions “Ever speak with the Russians.”  Two different questions, yet the media's focus is the latter, an edited question that was never asked. 

Leahy and Franken are confusing Sessions with Ted Kennedy who asked Russia to intervene In 1984 Election to defeat Reagan. A verifiable truth, just google it.

What comes to mind is Goebbels' famous words: "The most brilliant propagandist technique will yield no success unless one fundamental principle is borne in mind constantly - It must confine itself to a few points and repeat them over and over."   This is what we have here, a hit piece by a bunch of hacks, that cannot be proved (you can't prove a negative).

The Reich Minister of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda went on to say "...the truth is the mortal enemy of the lie, and thus by extension, the truth becomes the greatest enemy of the State."

Sad,  this why the once great NYT is losing subscribers.

Lynne thinks President Obama is the traitor. Specifically,

"Lynne Boston, MA
Additionally, to actively sabotage an incoming President? I am going to imagine the the adulation the former President believes he deserves may be treasonous. And that the former President is waiting in the wing with his old henchmen and women eagerly waiting to take over? Doubly treasonous. Alinsky could not have tutored a better student for revolution but do we want it?"

In the face of hard evidence republicans continue their strange naïveté which somehow only applies to republicans and never, ever to democrats. Emails are treason to these people but collusion with the Russians, Putin specifically? Nothing to see, folks...Trump has suddenly become honest after a long career of cheating to "win."

This is why you have lost whatever shreds of credibility you had before Trump was elected. This is so easily refuted as baloney, since you can actually read the questionnaire and the testimony, and if you actually did REPORTING instead of activist journalism, you would have seen that Sessions was responding to a very specific question about talking to Russians "about the election." Obviously he would have spoken to ambassadors in his role on Senate committees. This is just EMBARRASSING. For you. Or it should be.

How long before Trump and his obviously compromised admin try to pin this one on the press. At this point it looks like we may have an actual "enemy of the people", Trump and his admin. Watching them entertain us with having to deal with actual reality should be very interesting. Thank you president Obama for your cunning intellect.
" I am not a Russian."   The Presidential Apprentice.

In the words of the "esteemed" Donald Trump, "There are known knowns. These are things we know that we know. There are known unknowns. That is to say, there are things that we know we don't know. But there are also unknown unknowns. There are things we don't know we don't know. "
Hopefully a real investigation will take place and the the truth will out. I have faith in the Constitution and if that document still has meaning justice will be served. It worked to get another great presidential fraud R.M. Nixon out of office, If it worked then it can work again.

"Sessions' ties to the Russians" What ties? As a Senator he met with the Russian ambassador. Did any other Senators meet with the Russian ambassador? As far as "lying about a relationship to the Senate , Sessions was asked if he discussed campaign issue with Russians during a period of time, NOT if he had met with any Russians. This article is chock full of innuendo and incomplete and misleading information.
I would like to thank the movie gods for Jeff Session's stereo-typical racist slave master accent.  It is going to go down so easy with his resignation.

It defies common sense that with Session's legal and law enforcement background, he did not feel the need to make the record crystal clear by acknowledging meetings with the Russian ambassador in his capacity as a senator.

I would think that he would be acutely aware of the need to be forthcoming and clear about ALL meetings just to set the record straight. That he chose not to be forthcoming is highly suspicious to say the least.

He should have and would have known better than to hide the meeting with the Russian ambassador, unless of course he was pulling a "what the definition of "is" is".

Hey Mr. Trump, Americans really DO want to know—what's the deal with the Russians, the contacts, the denials, the forgetting of meetings, the desire to suppress investigations, the hiding of taxes? It's our country, you work for us, and we have a right to know.

Very strange and suspicious indeed!
Tom Steyer, liberal mega donor,  Is In So Deep With The Russians They Should Call Him ‘Impaled by Vlad’

Intercourse: "connections or dealings between persons or groups." (Miriam Webster)

So, it was a terrible, terrible thing that one president lied about something that did not rise to the level of sexual intercourse.

But, we should give a lawyer a pass for having intercourse with the enemy. And he forgot about it? Or lied about it?

It is time for everything in this country to take a back seat, while we investigate "what's going on."

And it's going on from within our borders. Indeed from within our White House.

If there was ever a time for a clean sweep of an entire administration, we've come to that time!

All together now: Independent Prosecutor!

Jeff Sessions lied while under oath.

Here are some highly impassioned statements made by Republicans in 1998 about Bill Clinton lying under oath about (of all things) his sex life. Here are just a few examples, of which there are many:

"This is not about politics, he lied! This is very simply about the Rule of Law, and the survival of the American system of justice! - Newt Gingrich

"There can be no justice without the truth!" - Then Rep. Nancy L. Johnson (R. Connecticut).

"I believe perjury does meet at least the definition of high misdemeanor. In my mind, it certainly meets the measure of high crime." -- Again, Rep. Nancy Johnson (R-Connecticut) .

" [He] certainly understood the gravity of his testimony and the expectation of truthfulness ... But is it impeachable? And the answer is yes!" - Then Rep. Asa Hutchinson (R-Arkansas).

" I do not believe it was justified because of what [He] has said, because I can no longer believe him!" - Then Rep. Tom Campbell (R-California).

" Let not history look back on this day and say there, on that date, America surrendered the rule of law!" - Then Rep. Kenny Hulshof (R-Missouri)
My god! This article is so shockingly revealing. Its a scary alarming scenario not only for the US but also for the Europeans, and the rest of the world.

It now noon on the east coast. What is astonishing is the silence that can be heard loud and clear from the White House for the past 15 something hours....

A meager rebuttal by Session's staff and amazingly not a tweet from the chief. If the AG is caught commiting perjury over the Russian connections, you know that there is more to this. They are caught with their pants down. Since Flynn, Sessions et al, love to communicate so much with this Russian ambassador, perhaps they should just fix him the Lincoln bedroom. At least until impeachment.
Impeach and Imprison.
